name: In-Dreams
description:
An unknown developer who went by VISICNS for a small window of time in the 1990s worked on virtual recreations of dreams submitted to them by mail. If the request was accepted, they’d recreate the dream and send one single copy to the original sender on a plain floppy disk with one single word based on the dream scribbled in black marker. According to VISICNS website (aprox. 1998) there were 23 different dreams that were created before they disappeared. Only a few have been at least partially discovered and rereleased online as of now.
